title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 March 2012 - XWiki

07:16 <vmassol> since 3.3

08:40 <vishnu> hi sdumitriu  
08:41 <vishnu> I cloned xwiki enterprise and did "mvn install"  
08:41 <@sdumitriu> Hi vishnu  
08:42 <vishnu> I got an error saying  
08:44 <vishnu> [ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project xwiki-enterprise-web: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.xwiki.enterprise:xwiki-enterprise-web:war:4.0-SNA PSHOT: The following artifacts could not be resolved: org.infinispan:infinispan- core:jar:5.1.1.FINAL, org.restlet.jse:org.restlet:jar:2.0.11, org.restlet.jee:or g.restlet.ext.servlet:jar:2.0.11, org.restlet.jse:org.restlet.ext.jaxrs:jar:2.0. 11, uk.ac.ed.ph.snuggletex:snuggle  
08:44 <vishnu> Could not find artifact  org.infinispan:infinispan-core:jar:5.1.1.FINAL in xwiki-externals (http://maven .xwiki.org/externals) -> [Help 1]  
08:45 <@sdumitriu> Did you setup the right settings.xml as indicated on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building#HInstallingMaven ?  
08:49 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
08:53 <vishnu> yes  
09:03 <@sdumitriu> Are you sure? I can see one of the files here: http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/infinispan/infinispan-core/5.1.1.FINAL/  
09:05 <vishnu> sdumitriu, When i created the settings.xml, I copied the "After august 2010" version..  
09:06 <vishnu> I don't know what mistake I did but, I copied it once again and right now the build is going fine :)

Next step is to move this code to XWiki Commons if we agree about it. - http://git.io/2WgRlg

13:03 <@cjd> vmassol: Your new version looks pretty good but still if I were writing it I would have used the way I linked above because for the reader it allows him to understand what it does, and satisfy himself that it is bug free the fastest way possible.  
13:04 <vmassol> your version provides no reuse  
13:04 <@cjd> If I were reading your version looking for bugs, I would go read the apache commons code then come back and after 20 minutes I would be happy that it did what it claims to do.  
13:04 <vmassol> no reuse = coder will need to understand the xwiki format and recode it manually every time making mistakes  
13:05 <@cjd> Yes, it's not reusable. But I tend not to try making things reusable until I have at least 3 or 4 uses of it ready to go.  
13:05 <vmassol> yes but we have that  
13:05 <vmassol> :)  
13:05 <@cjd> ahh ok, I don't know the specifics of rendering.  
13:05 <vmassol> it's not just in rendering  
13:07 <@cjd> One other small thing is since XWikiToStringStyle has no state, it would be marginally better performing to use XWikiToStringStyle.INSTANCE which holds a global instance of it.  
13:07 <vmassol> yep  
13:07 <vmassol> I agree  
13:08 <@cjd> Not complaining of course, we just got on this interesting conversation about what is the \*best\* way to do something :)  
13:11 <vmassol> actually I'm not 100% sure  
13:11 <vmassol> since it would mean users cannot bring small changes to the style  
13:12 <@cjd> You mean by extending it?  
13:12 <vmassol> nope  
13:12 <vmassol> I mean by :  
13:12 <vmassol> builder.getStyle().setXXX(...)  
13:12 <vmassol> they'll need to extend it to bring a modification even a small one  
13:13 <vmassol> and since toString are not supposed to be fast I don't see the pros of using a static final variable  
13:13 <vmassol> (singleton)  
13:13 <@cjd> well they would have to alter it to introduce state so it would be a change already  
13:13 <@cjd> and indeed, toString() shouldn't be a hot spot in sane code  
13:14 <+tmortagne> vmassol: no need to extend it they can do a new XWikiToStringStyle  
13:14 <vmassol> tmortagne: they just can  
13:15 <vmassol> I mean nothing will prevent them  
13:15 <vmassol> once they have the builder they can call getStyle()  
13:15 <+tmortagne> was answering to "they'll need to extend it"  
13:15 <vmassol> right  
13:16 <+tmortagne> I'm also +1 for XWikiToStringStyle.INSTANCE  
13:16 <+tmortagne> or actually  
13:16 <+tmortagne> XWikiToString.DEFAULT  
13:16 <+tmortagne> XWikiToString.EDFAULT\_STYLE  
13:16 <vmassol> it's so minor…. we're nitpicking for not much  
13:17 <+tmortagne> XWikiToStringBuilder.DEFAULT\_STYLE  
13:17 <@cjd> Wouldn't it be cool if you could annotate a field @Stateless and have the compiler fail if there are any modifyable fields anywhere under that field  
13:17 <vmassol> btw was looking for other places were it could be used and couldn't another place in rendering  
13:17 <vmassol> (well actually I've found one or two places but they're not toString impls)  
13:18 <+tmortagne> cjd: there is kind of a JSR about that but it's included in the JVM  
13:18 <@cjd> oh cool  
13:18 <+tmortagne> or maybe it's for other kind of annotations like that  
13:18 <+tmortagne> let me find it again  
13:18 <vmassol> ThreadSafe I think  
13:19 <@cjd> If there were 2 checkstyle rules I would favor, they would be "all unchanged local variables must be final", and "all references to object methods or fields must start with 'this.'"  I use "this." and "final" to communicate my intent to the compiler but if I don't use them, it makes my intent unclear.  
13:19 <+tmortagne> vmassol: not only, there is also Immutable and things like that  
13:20 <@cjd> Ofc that would be a huge break  
13:21 <+tmortagne> cjd: http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=305  
13:21 <vmassol> found another place in DefaultComponentRole… pfew :)  
13:22 <vmassol> DefaultExtensionPlanAction too I think  
13:22 <vmassol> it's wrongly using an invalid format now I think  
13:22 <vmassol> ok cool  
13:23 <vmassol> and a big one in Mail (mailsender)  
13:23 <vmassol> ok so we have our 4 places :)  
13:23 <+tmortagne> cjd: s/it's included/it's not included/  
13:24 <+tmortagne> maybe in Java 7 I don't know  
13:24 <+tmortagne> would be nice  
13:24 <@cjd> "Check return value annotation - an annotation that says ignoring the return value of a method is likely incorrect" <-- gcc supports this  
13:25 <@cjd> I wonder if findbugs has anything like this..  
13:26 <+tmortagne> cjd: findbugs has lots of stuff but don't know about this one in particular  
13:26 <+tmortagne> unless you mean if findbugs support some kind of comment syntax to indicate things like that ?  
13:28 <@cjd> Hmm, I don't see that specifically.. It would be nice since it's easy to check using static analisys, just rip open the class and look for modifyable fields.  
13:31 <@cjd> http://joe-e.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/library/src/org/joe\_e/Immutable.java <-- the Object Capability guys are doing it  
13:43 <@cjd> http://grepcode.com/file\_/repo1.maven.org/maven2/org.apache.commons/commons-lang3/3.0.1/org/apache/commons/lang3/builder/ToStringStyle.java/?v=source  
13:43 <@cjd> this is terrible :(  
13:44 <@cjd> It's full of globals which are mutable  
13:48 <@cjd> hm all of the mutators are protected  
13:50 <@cjd> not that bad but hard to debug
